page.title: 02DUDMASTON HALL SHROPSHIRE
page.content: { Dudmaston estate}has been in existence for over{800 years.}It has enjoyed a varied history and in recent years has undergone a revival. The present hall is by Francis Smith of Warwick. Built between 1695 and 1701 with additions in the 1820's. Only minor alterations have been made since that time and the hall is now owned by the{National Trust. The house is{open to the public,}with 12 rooms on display. There are{six {galleries}covering the following themes:- 1) 20th century paintings and sculptures. 2) 20th century Spanish pictures. 3) Topographical Watercolours. 4) Botanical Art. 5) The Darbys of Coalbrookdale 6) Miscellaneous Art.
